definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
official records/grade (of goods)/file/records/shelves/slot/gap/crosspiece/classifier for crosspieces/classifier for events, affairs etc/Taiwan pr. [dang3]

sentences.english: We ate dinner at a food stall last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上我們在大排檔吃了一頓飯。

sentences.english: " said one staff from a "Chicken Finger large stall" in Zhong San Village.
sentences.chinese: 鍾三村一家叫“雞腳大排檔”的員工說。

sentences.english: Photo is of an African youth eating at a food stall.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲一名非洲青年在大排檔喫飯。

sentences.english: Photo is of Africans drinking beer at a food stall.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲在大排檔喝啤酒的非洲人。

sentences.english: It looks like a greasy spoon but the potstickers are great and the price is cheap.
sentences.chinese: 它有點象大排檔，但鍋貼物美價廉。

sentences.english: To the food stalls in Bangkok, Thailand Chimi Fen, is a pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 到泰國曼谷大排檔喫米粉，是一種享受。

sentences.english: I will go and eat at hawker stalls but not at places that are deemed 'complicated'.
sentences.chinese: 我會去大排檔喫東西，但我不會去品流複雜的地方。

sentences.english: These snacks at the night market food stalls often join in the entry is the greatest.
sentences.chinese: 這些小喫在夜市大排檔裏往往捧場的入是最多的。

definition: (sitting) opposite/across (the street)/directly in front/to be face to face
rice noodle roll, a roll made from sheets of rice flour dough, steamed and stuffed with meat, vegetables etc
Wan Chai district of Hong Kong
the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
